ChildCareTech.model

Class AbstractGenericDAO<T extends iEntity,K extends java.io.Serializable>

  • java.lang.Object
    • ChildCareTech.model.AbstractGenericDAO<T,K>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of entity on which this DAO is operating
    K - the type of the key of the aforementioned entity
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AdultDAO, BusDAO, CanteenDAO, CheckpointDAO, DishDAO, EventDAO, FoodDAO, KidDAO, MealDAO, MenuDAO, PediatristDAO, PersonDAO, RouteDAO, StaffDAO, SupplierDAO, SupplyDAO, TripDAO, TripPartecipationDAO, UserDAO, WorkDayDAO

    public abstract class AbstractGenericDAO<T extends iEntity,K extends java.io.Serializable>
extends java.lang.Object
    Represent a generic Data Access Object.

    Provides implementations for the basic CRUD operations.

    • Field Detail

      • session

        protected org.hibernate.Session session
        The Hibernate Session needed by this dao to perform every operations. It must be opened and with an active transaction to perform successfully any operation. The manage of sessions/transaction is job of the developer that uses this class.

      • read

        public T read(T obj)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the entity with corresponding primary key

      • read

        public java.util.List<T> read(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> params)
        Read a list of entities matching the constraints specified in the params map.

        Each entry of the aforementioned map specify the value for an attribute that an entity must match to be read. For each entry, a where clause is added to the read query: (String) attribute = (Object) value.

        Parameters:
        params - a map containing the name of the attribute as key and the corresponding value as value.
        Returns:
        a list of entity matching the specified constraints.

      • read

        public java.util.List<T> read(java.lang.String paramName,
                              java.lang.Object paramValue)
        Read a list of entities matching the constraints specified in the params map.

        Each entry of the aforementioned map specify the value for an attribute that an entity must match to be read. For each entry, a where clause is added to the read query: (String) attribute = (Object) value.

        Parameters:
        paramName - the name of the attribute.
        paramValue - the value of the attribute.
        Returns:
        a list of entity matching the specified constraints.

      • readAll

        public java.util.List<T> readAll()
        Returns:
        a list containing all the entities of this type saved in the database.

      • update

        public void update(T updatedObj)
            throws ValidationFailedException
        Update the provided entity's state in the database.
        Parameters:
        updatedObj - the entity whose state is going to be saved in the database.
        Throws:
        ValidationFailedException - if the provided entity does not pass some validations constraints.
        org.hibernate.HibernateException - if some database constraints are violated.

      • delete

        public void delete(T obj)
        Remove the provided entity from the database.
        Parameters:
        obj - the entity to be removed.
        Throws:
        org.hibernate.HibernateException - if some database constraints are violated.
